turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Angami language.
turn.1: What are the different languages spoken in Angami?
turn.2: Angami language  Angami (also: Gnamei, Ngami, Tsoghami, Tsugumi, Monr, Tsanglo, Tenyidie) is an Naga language language spoken in the Naga Hills in the northeastern part of India, in Kohima district, Nagaland.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In 2001, there is an estimate of 125,000 first language (L1) Angami speakers. Under the UNESCO’s Language Vitality and Endangerment framework, Angami is at the level of "vulnerable", meaning that it is still spoken by most children, but "may be restricted to certain domains".
turn.5: What are some of the domains?
turn.6: There are several dialects, the most prominent being Khwuno dialect (around Khonoma village) , Tenyidie Kewhi dialect (in the state capital of Kohima) and Viswe or southern dialect (southern Angami area).
turn.7: Are there any other languages spoken there?
turn.8: Others include Dzüna, Kehena, Chakroma (Western Angami), Mima, Nali, Mozome.
turn.9: Which language is spoken the most?
turn.10: Tenyidie is the prestige dialect, used for publications and taught in the schools.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: "Ethnologue" lists the following dialects of Angami.
